This, Great Strength!

If a son of a good family learns a craft to make a living, whether farming, trading, writing as a clerk, learning mathematics, learning calculation, learning seals, learning poetry, learning to be a guard, teaching writing, or enlisting in the king's service, he suffers from the cold, the heat, hunger, thirst, and is bitten by mosquitoes, flies, and fleas, seeking wealth.

That clansman, having arisen like this, acted like this, and diligently practiced like this, but was unable to obtain money. He then became sorrowful, unhappy, wept, beat his chest, and increased his delusion by diligently practicing without attaining the fruit.
That clansman, having arisen like this, acted like this, and diligently practiced like this, then obtained wealth. Having obtained wealth, he guarded it.
Do not let the king take away this wealth of mine, do not let thieves steal it, do not let it be burned by fire, do not let it rot, do not let it be lost by not earning interest.

He guarded that wealth, but it was taken away by the king, stolen by thieves, burned by fire, rotted, and he was unable to earn interest. He then became sorrowful, unhappy, wept, beat his chest, and increased his delusion.
Furthermore, what is lovable and delightful for a long time is all destroyed and lost. This is called, Great Strength!
This present body is the cause of the aggregate of suffering. Because of lust, up to excessive lust, this is the cause of lust.

Because of lust, up to the cause of excessive lust, a mother quarrels with her son, a son quarrels with his mother, a father quarrels with his son, a son quarrels with his father, a brother quarrels with his sister, a sister quarrels with her brother, let alone man with man?

Is the present suffering aggregate, because of lust, up to the cause of excessive lust.
This, O mighty one!

Because of lust, up to the cause of excessive lust, a king quarrels with a king, a brahmin quarrels with a brahmin, a householder quarrels with a householder, a thief quarrels with a thief, a craftsman quarrels with a craftsman, they each quarrel with each other, making various weapons, either with fists, or with stones, or with knives and sticks, in which some die or suffer death. This is called, O mighty one!

This, Great Man!

The present mass of suffering is due to lust, up to the supremacy of lust.
This, Great Man!
Beings, due to lust, up to the supremacy of lust, put on armor, take up bows and arrows, put on leather armor, hold extremely sharp swords, and go to a very high city to attack it.
This, Great King, is the present suffering aggregate, due to lust and excessive lust.
This, Great King, is the present suffering aggregate, due to lust and excessive lust.

Because of lust, up to the most extreme lust, sentient beings perform painful bodily actions, painful verbal and mental actions. At that time, if they become ill and suffer, lying on a bed or in a shady place, with extreme pain in the body, painful to the extreme, unhappy, with life about to end,

It means that their bodily, verbal, and mental actions are painful. When they die, they hang upside down, just like the sun at dusk when it sets behind a large mountain, with the mountain's shadow hanging upside down.
In the same way, when they die, their bodily, verbal, and mental actions are painful, and they hang upside down.
They think:

'This bodily, verbal, and mental action is painful, hanging upside down. I did not do what is to be done, did not do what is meritorious. I have done much evil, namely, I have done evil, been greedy, and been violent. I have not done meritorious actions, not done good actions, not done what leads to a destination. I will certainly fall into that destination.'
This then leads to regret.
Having regretted, their death is also unwholesome, and their rebirth is also unwholesome. This, Great Strong Man!
Is the present body's suffering aggregate, which arises from desire and increases due to excessive desire.
This, Great Strong Man!

Sentient beings, due to desire, up to the most extreme desire, engage in bodily, verbal, and mental suffering. Having engaged in bodily, verbal, and mental suffering, they, due to that cause and that condition, upon the break-up of the body, after death, are born in a bad realm, a difficult realm, a hell.
This, Great Strength,
is the cause of the later arising of the suffering of the body, due to desire, up to the most extreme desire.
This, Great Strength,
is the five flavors of desire, with much suffering and destruction.
This noble disciple,

Thus, Great Strength,
the noble disciple is associated with the dharma of desire.

I know the little flavor of desire, I know the suffering, I know the destruction, I know and see as it really is, and I do not dwell in the protection and peace created by the evil and unwholesome dharmas of desire, namely the unsurpassed peace.

not in accord with the dharmas of lust.
